title: Celtics unveil new gold City Edition jerseys for 2025-26 season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "The word mark and number set are trimmed in black, making this our first uniform to not feature green.
" The Celtics unveiled their new City Edition jerseys on Wednesday.

Courtesy of Boston Celtics By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 7:05 AM 1 minute to read The Celtics are changing things up with their City Edition jerseys this season — forgoing green for the first time ever.

title: Red Sox playoff picture: Wednesday’s win has Boston on brink of postseason berth
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox just need a win over the Blue Jays — or an Astros loss — on Thursday to clinch a playoff spot.
Garrett Crochet's eight shutout innings led Boston to a win on Wednesday.
(Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP) By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 7:00 AM 3 minutes to read The Red Sox are on the cusp of playing October baseball for the first time since 2021.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.
Al's Cafe will open a new location downtown this fall.

title: West Roxbury man killed in accident at Mass. millwork business
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News “He was a friend, a craftsman, and someone we were lucky to know,” Materia Millwork wrote in response to their employee’s death.
By Darin Zullo September 24, 2025 | 7:02 PM 1 minute to read A West Roxbury man died Tuesday after he suffered fatal injuries in a workplace accident in Avon, officials said.
David Morais, 28, has been identified as the victim, the Norfolk District Attorney’s Office and Avon police said in a statement.

title: ‘Disturbing trend’: Malden man, married to U.S. citizen, detained by ICE
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The arrest is apparently part of "Operation Patriot 2.
0" as ICE continues to target people "who are easy to pick up" as they go through the system, a lawyer said.
Photos of Leslie Perlera Gonzalez and Edgar Hernan Elias Escobar on their wedding day.

title: Bill Belichick, Jordon Hudson reportedly don’t plan to get married
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Bill Belichick is not going to get married; he is smarter than that.
" Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson continue to generate headlines.

AP Photo/Chris Seward By Conor Ryan September 24, 2025 | 5:49 PM 2 minutes to read As Bill Belichick and the UNC Tar Heels continue to trudge through an up-and-down 2025 season, the drama off the field for the former Patriots coach doesn’t appear to be quieting down.

title: Lexington’s housing boom proves green building policies don’t slow development
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Real Estate A surge in new housing construction is challenging long-held assumptions about green building and multifamily zoning policies, Canary Media reported.
BXP Inc.
, formerly known as Boston Properties, plans to demolish a one-story research and development building in Lexington it acquired in 1976 and build a 312-unit apartment complex in its place.

title: What’s happening with the MassDOT service plaza deal?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Uncertainty surrounds the project after the selected developer exited following legal action and a media campaign by a rival bidder.
Service plaza in Natick.
David L Ryan/The Boston Globe The company chosen to redevelop 18 aging highway service plazas across Massachusetts has backed out of the deal, leaving the project in limbo.

title: Peabody teacher no longer employed after Charlie Kirk comments
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The teacher, who worked at Peabody Veterans Memorial High School, “will not be returning to their position.
" Another teacher is still under investigation.
Items at a makeshift memorial for Charlie Kirk.

title: Why haven’t the Patriots played Efton Chism yet? Mike Vrabel explains.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "We'll evaluate that each week as to what his role would be and how he can help us.
" Efton Chism scores a touchdown during a Patriots-Vikings preseason game in August.
AP Photo/Abbie Parr FOXBOROUGH – Efton Chism was a training camp star, but the rookie wide receiver has yet to see the field for the Patriots through three regular season games.
